bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Rodolfo Matas, November 4, 1941

div1.p: Hench requests reprints of anything Matas has published on yellow fever, and is especially anxious to have a copy of his tribute to Finlay.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Rodolfo Matas, November 4, 1941
div1.opener:
Y F.
November 4, 1941
Dr. Rudolph Matas
3523 Prytania Street
New Orleans, Louisiana
My dear Doctor Matas:
div1.p:
It was such a pleasure for me to have the privilege of meeting you
and talking over the fascinating story of the conquest of yellow fever. I
appreciated also your giving me the reprint. Especially do I appreciate your
permission to look over, at your leisure, your material, and will ask your
secretary to send me any other such reprints as you may have that you have
written on the story of yellow fever in New Orleans and elsewhere. I am
anxious particularly to have your tribute to Dr. Finlay, and if and when you
can have this copied, I would be very glad indeed to have it. I realize
that I am asking a good deal of you but I do so with the knowledge that I
have at heart the same interest that you do; namely a desire to see that
those who accomplished so much in the conquest of yellow fever get contin-
ued recognition. It is with that thought in mind that I am planning con-
tinued study in preparation for writing a monograph on the subject.

I sincerely hope that we may have the privilege of seeing you again
at the Mayo Clinic some time, even though your friends, Dr. Will and Dr.
Charlie no longer are with us.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
